title: Police Investigate Homicide on 37th Street
body:
Prince George’s County, Maryland The Prince George’s County Police Department’s Homicide Unit is investigating a homicide that occurred last night in Brentwood, Maryland.On December 9, 2011, at approximately 10:30 p.m., patrol officers responded to the 4600 block of 37 Street for the report of a shooting.  Upon arrival, officers found 21 year oldEisenhower Kevin Victor, of the 3500 block of Windom Road in Brentwood, lying on the roadway suffering from a gunshot wound.  He was transported to a local hospital and pronounced deceased shortly after.  Detectives are currently working to identify a suspect(s) and motive in this case.Anyone with information about this case is asked to call the Prince George’s County Police Department’s Homicide Unit at (301) 772-4925.  Callers wishing to remain anonymous may call Crime Solvers at 1-866-411 TIPS (8477) text “PGPD plus your message” to CRIMES (274637) on your cell phone or go to http://www.princegeorgescountymd.gov/police/ submit a tip online.
